fields.headline: Old Joy
fields.bodyText: The pretentious, low-budget, Kelly Reichardt's Old Joy is about an unsatisfactory reunion between two friends at some hot springs hidden in the woods below Oregon's Cascade Mountains. One is an ageing itinerant hippie (eccentric singer-composer Will Oldham). The other (edgy Daniel London), married and about to become a father, drives a Volvo estate, which in movies always signifies someone who's opted for the settled, responsible, unostentatious life. It's a minimalist piece to be savoured like a good short story.
